upgradeSummary: This tool provides the mandatory sequential path to upgrade your instance safely.
Each version listed is a mandatory stop with specific instructions. Do not skip any steps.
Before you begin, please review the checklists and common warnings below.

preUpgrade: Backup your database and configuration files.
Review changelogs for all versions in your upgrade path.
Schedule the upgrade during a low-traffic period.
postUpgrade: Verify all services have restarted successfully.
Clear your browser cache to see the latest UI changes.
Monitor system performance and error logs.

commonWarnings.title: Potential Downtime
commonWarnings.details: The upgrade process requires restarting services, which will result in a brief period of downtime.

instructions: This migration is a one-time process. Once it is successfully completed, your system will be fully transitioned to the new metrics exporter.
The migration scripts are idempotent, so there is no need to worry about running them multiple times.
After completing the migration, remove any configuration changes made for it, based on your deployment type.

warnings.title: signoz-otel-collector version
warnings.details: Version is greater or equal to v0.111.29

warnings.title: Dual Exporter Setup
warnings.details: Both Exporters clickhousemetricswrite and signozclickhousemetrics exporters are enabled  for your metrics retention period.

instructions: This is not a breaking change release. No special actions are needed.
This is a major upgrade consolidating `query-service`, `frontend`, and `alertmanager` into a single `signoz` binary. Careful migration is required.
The frontend port has changed from `3301` to `8080`. Update your reverse proxy or ingress configurations accordingly.
For Kubernetes, backup the SQLite database, replace the `queryService` key with `signoz` in `my-values.yaml`, and configure the migration `initContainer` as per the guide.
For Docker Standalone & Swarm, you must be on version `v0.70.0` before upgrading to `v0.76.0`.
After a successful upgrade, the migration container in Kubernetes should be disabled, and old unused volumes can be deleted.
If you see an 'Oops! Something went wrong' screen, try logging out and back in, or clearing your browser's local storage.

deprecations.title: Service Consolidation
deprecations.details: The separate `query-service`, `frontend`, and `alertmanager` services/containers are deprecated and have been replaced by a single `signoz` binary.

deprecations.title: Helm Chart Configuration
deprecations.details: In Kubernetes `my-values.yaml`, the top-level key `queryService` is deprecated and must be replaced with `signoz`.

deprecations.title: Frontend Port
deprecations.details: The default frontend port `3301` is deprecated. The new service runs on port `8080`.

deprecations.title: Old Volumes
deprecations.details: The PersistentVolumeClaims for `query-service` and `alertmanager` (Kubernetes) and the `signoz-alertmanager` volume (Docker) are no longer used and can be deleted after migration.

warnings.title: Database Backup Required (Kubernetes)
warnings.details: Before starting the upgrade on Kubernetes, you must backup your SQLite database (`signoz.db`) to prevent data loss.

warnings.title: Version Prerequisite (Docker/Swarm)
warnings.details: Users on Docker Standalone or Docker Swarm must first be on version `v0.70.0` before attempting to upgrade to `v0.76.0`.

warnings.title: Alertmanager Email Configuration
warnings.details: If you are using Alertmanager to send emails, you will need to re-apply your configuration after upgrading. Refer to the documentation for details.
